info.description: A Lucidworks Fusion microservice for indexing.
info.title: Fusion Indexing Service API

tags.name: index-pipeline-controller
tags.description: Used for indexing documents and managing pipeline definitions

tags.name: ind`ex-pipeline-template-controller
tags.description: Used internally to generate index pipelines from a template.

tags.name: index-profile-controller
tags.description: The Index Profiles API allows users to manage index profiles. Index profiles allow users to change index pipelines during indexing time while pointing the indexing toward a static endpoint. This gives flexibility to test different stage combinations without reconfiguration.

tags.name: index-profile-crud-controller
tags.description: Endpoints to perform Create-Read-Update-Delete operations on Index Profiles.

tags.name: index-stage-controller
tags.description: The Index Stages API provides endpoints to: 1) manage index stage instances, 2) list index stage configuration properties

tags.name: parser-controller
tags.description: Endpoints to perform Create-Read-Update-Delete operations on Parsers.

tags.name: parser-template-controller
tags.description: Used internally to generate parser configs from a template.

tags.name: plugin-controller
tags.description: Provides endpoints to manage index stage plugins.

get.summary: Get JSON schema for objects managed by this API
getStatus
Get the entity as JSON by unique ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The entity ID

post.summary: Index document and return response with additional debugging info.
post.description: The document format must match application/vnd.lucidworks-document or application/vnd.solr-document. Indexing means that a document will be processed by all of the configured index stages.

parameters.name: bufferDocsForSolr
parameters.description: Indicates if the SolrIndexStage should buffer docs or not.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The target collection Id where indexed documents will be stored.

parameters.name: documents
parameters.description: List of PipelineDocument objects to be processed and ingested.

parameters.name: echo
parameters.description: If true, indexed documents will be returned in the response

parameters.name: echoMaxCount
parameters.description: Indicates how many documents should be included in response from the pipeline with -1 implying all.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the index pipeline to be used.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Request query params

parameters.name: simulate
parameters.description: Run the pipeline in "simulate" mode for these docs. Stages with "side-effects" will get skipped

parameters.name: throwOnError
parameters.description: Indicates if the indexing should proceed if an error is encountered or if it should throw an exception

post.summary: Index document and return indexing stats.
post.description: The request body should be the document passed as binary data. Indexing means that a document will be processed by all of the configured index stages.

parameters.name: autoDetectFormat
parameters.description: Deprecated

parameters.name: bufferDocsForSolr
parameters.description: Indicates if the SolrIndexStage should buffer docs or not.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The target collection Id where indexed documents will be stored.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: MIME type

parameters.name: contentSourceName
parameters.description: Content resource name (file name) on the source system

parameters.name: echo
parameters.description: If true, indexed documents will be returned in the response

parameters.name: echoMaxCount
parameters.description: Indicates how many documents should be included in response from the pipeline with -1 implying all.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the index pipeline to be used.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: Request query params

parameters.name: parserId
parameters.description: Id of the parser to be used

parameters.name: simulate
parameters.description: Run the pipeline in "simulate" mode for these docs. Stages with "side-effects" will get skipped

parameters.name: skipParsing
parameters.description: Skip the parsing and treat document as byte stream

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: Deprecated

parameters.name: stats
parameters.description: Collect pipeline processing stats and return them in the response

parameters.name: throwOnError
parameters.description: Indicates if the indexing should proceed if an error is encountered or if it should throw an exception

post.summary: Index document without returning indexing stats.
post.description: The request body should be the document passed as binary data. Indexing means that a document will be processed by all of the configured index stages.

parameters.name: distrib
parameters.description: distrib

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of a specific pipeline

parameters.name: context
parameters.description:
Validates which app the entity should be part of by specifying, for example, 
                                                "app:SomeApp". If the entity is not part of the app this request will fail. 
                                                Any other comma-separated contexts in the context parameter are allowed but ignored.

post.summary: Parse document passed as binary data.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: MIME type

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the parser to be used

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of documents to parse

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first document that will actually be processed. Documents with ordinals from 0 to offset will be skipped.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description:
Validates which app the entity should be part of by specifying, for example, 
                                                "app:SomeApp". If the entity is not part of the app this request will fail. 
                                                Any other comma-separated contexts in the context parameter are allowed but ignored.

put.description: When changes are made to a subscription, the subscription needs to be refreshed (reloaded). A Fusion restart refreshes all subscriptions.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to apply when refreshing the subscription. This is currently either start or stop.

                                                Any other comma-separated contexts in the context parameter are allowed but ignored.

get.summary: Get any subscriptions associated with the given resource and, optionally, topics

Validates which app the entity should be part of by specifying, for example,
